column5: Hey everyone,  I bought the 3" Berkly Gulp Alive Leech. I have not yet used it and my question is what ways can you rig this bait.  Thanks
I've tip'd a white or black jig head the same you would do with a real leech. I can see them working on a walleye (pickeral) rig as well.
You could do all kinds of things.  Rig is as a swimbait, dropshot it...  Whatever you want really.. It's pretty versatile.

I have never used them, just looked at the picture from Berkley`s website. Just from looking at it as a trailer on a bass style jig, as a trailer on a spinner bait, on a ball or mushroom(worm nosed) jig, like mentioned drop shot rig, hooked thru the nose and cast weightless thru weeds or lilies.  Just depends on what you want to try.
I bought two pails of the stuff to give a go this season for drop-shot'n..Not the leech but both patterns of shiner. I am new to the baits as well and have only heard great things about it!
